title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed to a sold-out crowd at Mohegan Sun Arena, showcasing a mix of blues and ballads.
Stapleton's setlist included fan favorites like 'Tennessee Whiskey' and a surprise rendition of 'Free Bird'.
The eight-piece band, featuring notable members like Paul Franklin and Morgane Stapleton, provided a tight performance.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots may cut Stefon Diggs to save $16.8 million in cap space despite his strong relationship with quarterback Drake Maye.
New England could release wide receivers DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, or Kayshon Boutte, saving $3-$4 million per player.
Linebacker Christian Elliss and center Garrett Bradbury are potential cut candidates with non-guaranteed salaries, offering cap savings.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not debut in Sunday's Celtics-76ers game, still recovering from a May Achilles injury.
Philadelphia's Joel Embiid is also out, missing the game due to an oblique strain, expected to miss three games.
The Celtics, second in the East, lead the season series 1-2 against the 76ers, who rank sixth.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs against the Twins, making three homers in the first week of spring training.
Duran showed improvement against left-handed pitchers, hitting home runs against Taj Bradley and Kendry Rojas in recent games.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora hinted Duran might see more action if his spring performance continues, potentially altering lineup plans.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored a combined 39 goals for Boston College this season.
Boston College sophomore Dean Letourneau improved to 19 goals this season after scoring none as a freshman.
The Bruins' prospect pool sees resurgence with strong college performances and four first-round picks in upcoming seasons.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An NBA assistant coach considers the Boston Celtics the clear favorite to win the Eastern Conference.
The Celtics rank second in offensive rating, while Boston's net rating leads the league since Thanksgiving.
Despite trailing the Pistons, the Celtics are closely matched with their rivals on a per-possession basis.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The concert featured a mix of Americana, Southern rock, country, and folk, showcasing Isbell's lyrical depth and musical versatility.
The setlist included old favorites and new hits, along with covers like The Rolling Stones’ "Can’t You Hear Me Knocking."

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers Trey Hendrickson, Jaelan Phillips, and Odafe Oweh due to high costs.
Raiders' Maxx Crosby probably not moving until NFL Draft; potential trade requires at least two first-round picks.
Patriots might target edge rusher in draft; have 31st pick and interest in Missouri's Zion Young.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount's acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion is pending regulatory approval.
Deal likely leads to partial integration of CBS and TNT/TBS, enhancing sports broadcast collaboration.
Netflix may pursue CBS NFL broadcasting rights after exiting Warner Bros. Discovery bidding.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly interested in A.J. Brown but consider the Eagles' asking price too high.
Trading A.J. Brown before June 1 would cost the Eagles $44 million in dead money.
Patriots might need Stefon Diggs to restructure his contract to fit both wide receivers on the roster.
